00051 void Face::addOwnNormals() {
00052     //Check that there are some vertices to do this on, otherwise there is an error
00053     if (vertexIndex.size() == 0) {
00054         return;
00055     }
00056 
00057     //Set all of the normalIndexes to the same things as the vertexIndex, so that each vertex has its own normal
00058     normalIndex = vertexIndex;
00059 
00060     //Different methods if it is a fan or strip
00061     if (isFan) {
00062         //Put in the new normals for this face here
00063         std::vector<Point3> thisFaceNormals;
00064         thisFaceNormals.resize(normalIndex.size());
00065 
00066         //This is the base of the fan
00067         Point3 root = (*vertices)[vertexIndex[0]];
00068 
00069         //Go through each triangle, calculate the normal, then add it to all of the points of that
00070         for (int i = 1; i < vertexIndex.size() - 1; i++) {
00071             Point3 thisNormal = Point3::cross(((*vertices)[vertexIndex[i + 1]] - root), ((*vertices)[vertexIndex[i]] - root)).getUnit();
00072             thisFaceNormals[0] = thisFaceNormals[0] + thisNormal;
00073             thisFaceNormals[i+1] = thisFaceNormals[i+1] + thisNormal;
00074             thisFaceNormals[i] = thisFaceNormals[i] + thisNormal;
00075         }
00076 
00077         //Now add each of these face normals to the actual stack of normals
00078         for (int i = 0; i < thisFaceNormals.size(); i++) {
00079             //printf("Trying to check %i, normalIndex %i\n", i, normalIndex[i]);
00080             (*normals)[normalIndex[i]] = (*normals)[normalIndex[i]] + thisFaceNormals[i];
00081         }
00082     } else {
00083         //Put in the new normals for this face here
00084         std::vector<Point3> thisFaceNormals;
00085         thisFaceNormals.resize(normalIndex.size());
00086 
00087         //Go through each triangle, calculate the normal, then add it to all of the points of that
00088         for (int i = 0; i < vertexIndex.size() - 2; i++) {
00089             Point3 thisNormal;
00090             //Orientation is different depending on whether i is even or odd
00091             if (i %1 == 0) {
00092                 thisNormal = Point3::cross(((*vertices)[vertexIndex[i + 1]] - (*vertices)[vertexIndex[i]]), ((*vertices)[vertexIndex[i + 2]] - (*vertices)[vertexIndex[i]])).getUnit();
00093             } else {
00094                 thisNormal = Point3::cross(((*vertices)[vertexIndex[i + 2]] - (*vertices)[vertexIndex[i]]), ((*vertices)[vertexIndex[i + 1]] - (*vertices)[vertexIndex[i]])).getUnit();
00095             }
00096             thisFaceNormals[i] = thisFaceNormals[i] + thisNormal;
00097             thisFaceNormals[i+1] = thisFaceNormals[i+1] + thisNormal;
00098             thisFaceNormals[i+2] = thisFaceNormals[i+2] + thisNormal;
00099         }
00100 
00101         //Now add each of these face normals to the actual stack of normals
00102         for (int i = 0; i < thisFaceNormals.size(); i++) {
00103             (*normals)[normalIndex[i]] = (*normals)[normalIndex[i]] + thisFaceNormals[i];
00104         }
00105     }
00106 }
00107 
00108 //Draw the face to the screen
00109 bool Face::drawFace() {
00110     if (isFan) {
00111         glBegin(GL_TRIANGLE_FAN);
00112     } else {
00113         glBegin(GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP);
00114     }
00115     if (normals != NULL) {
00116         for (int i = 0; i < vertexIndex.size(); i++) {
00117             (*normals)[normalIndex[i]].doNormal();
00118             (*vertices)[vertexIndex[i]].doVertex();
00119         }
00120     } else {
00121         for (int i = 0; i < vertexIndex.size(); i++) {
00122             (*vertices)[vertexIndex[i]].doVertex();
00123         }
00124     }
00125     glEnd();
00126     return true;
00127 }
